definition: to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
oath/vow/to swear/to pledge
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan
oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia

sentences.english: Though having exchanging solemn vows and pledges, support the abrasion not going over time after all.
sentences.chinese: 雖然有海誓山盟，終究抵不過時間的磨蝕。

sentences.english: They vowed their love would endure forever.
sentences.chinese: 他們海誓山盟地久天長。

sentences.english: Drink toasts of love and commitment.
sentences.chinese: 爲相愛和海誓山盟而乾杯。

sentences.english: I love you and would never leave you.
sentences.chinese: 不需要海誓山盟，因爲那些都很假。

sentences.english: The two lovers exchange solemn vows and pledges without any impurity.
sentences.chinese: 兩情相悅海誓山盟沒有任何雜質的感情。

sentences.english: True love will understand, what is the exchange solemn vows and pledges never separated.
sentences.chinese: 真心相愛的人才會懂，什麼叫海誓山盟永不分離。

sentences.english: Let's take a lover's vow and then seal it with a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 我們互許海誓山盟，以吻封住誓言。

sentences.english: Once a solemn pledge of love has been already indifferent, did two persons lead along by hand and really already go to the end?
sentences.chinese: 曾經的海誓山盟都已淡漠，兩人牽手真的已走到盡頭？

sentences.english: You just said that exchange solemn vows and pledges, but I did not listen.
sentences.chinese: 那些海誓山盟，你只是隨便一說，可我沒有隨便一聽。
